source.author: Jeanes, J.A.
source.title: Euphorbiaceae
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 4. Cornaceae to Asteraceae
source.citation: From: Jeanes, J.A. (1999). Euphorbiaceae. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 4. Cornaceae to Asteraceae. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Leaf margins usually crenate, wavy or entire, occasionally bluntly serrate; leaf bases never cordate; lamina never 2-, 4- or 5-lobed; petiole not more than half lamina length; north-western Victoria only

Leaf margins usually sharply or bluntly serrate, sometimes more or less crenate (but then bases cordate), rarely entire; lamina sometimes 2–5-lobed; petiole to more than half lamina length; East Gippsland only
